abstract: Port Morris Distillery in the Bronx, which makes Puerto Rican-style liquor called pitorro, represents rise of artisanal beer and spirit industry in the borough; trend follows similar developments of industry and gentrification in Queens and Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: The Port Morris Distillery, which makes pitorro, or “Puerto Rican moonshine,” is part of a growing industry of artisanal beer and spirits in the borough.

headline.main: Pitorro, Anyone? Craft Distilleries and Breweries Take Hold in South Bronx
headline.print_headline: Pitorro, Anyone? Craft Distilleries and Breweries Take Hold in South Bronx

snippet: The Port Morris Distillery, which makes pitorro, or “Puerto Rican moonshine,” is part of a growing industry of artisanal beer and spirits in the borough.
